cluster_relations.rel_desc: Sports are framed as a force that can be used to achieve positive change.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: As we continue to celebrate the role of sports in our culture

remarks: Direction chosen as sports â†’ positive change to reflect instrumental use.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: There is an explicitly celebrated role that sports play in culture.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: role of sports in our culture
remarks: Modeled as sports possessing a role entity rather than repeating influence relation.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Connects an activity, practice, or instrument to a purpose or outcome it can be used to achieve.
args.justification: The relation describes sports being framed instrumentally as a force to achieve positive change, which is a classic purpose/usage predicate; a normalized predicate-style label 'is_used_for' fits multiple similar cases.
This relation links an agentive domain concept (sports) to an intended outcome (positive change), grouping naturally with other purpose/goal-oriented predicates.
The semantic focus is on how sports are used or leveraged to achieve a particular outcome, which falls under broad usage/instrumentality rather than pure causality.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links a social practice or institution to an abstract role it plays within a culture or society.
args.justification: The relation describes the culturally celebrated role that sports play; this is best modeled as a social-role predicate rather than as a generic influence or purpose relation.
This predicate connects sports to an abstract role entity in culture, which fits a family of relations describing institutional or practice roles in society.
A social role is an aspect of the functional identity or position of an entity within a social system; thus it is best grouped under a broad identity/role dimension.
